metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0592 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component in Oracle Virtualization VirtualBox before 4.3.36 and before 5.0.14 allows local users to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Core.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-qt - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> precise likely not-affected, not listed in entry matrix for this CVE

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.14-dfsg-1').
